lead_paragraph: Anti-immigration groups and right-wing extremists have seized on a wave of assaults in Cologne, Germany, on New Year’s Eve to discredit all migrants as criminals or hooligans.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from London, Gaia Pianigiani from Rome, Kimberly Bradley from Vienna, and Richard Orange from Malmo, Sweden.

snippet: Anti-immigration groups and right-wing extremists have seized on a wave of assaults in Cologne, Germany, on New Year’s Eve to discredit all migrants as criminals or hooligans.

headline.main: Sexual Attacks Widen Divisions in European Migrant Crisis
headline.print_headline: Sexual Attacks Widen Europe’s Split on Migrants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

abstract: Revelations of New Year's Eve sexual assaults in Cologne, Germany, by gangs consisting of mostly foreigners, including some refugees, along with reports of similar attacks has heightened public anxiety about migrant crisis across Europe; far-right groups have seized on news reports of assaults, which have already started to influence asylum policy in some countries.
